doc.previous: Once the corrected 14 C/12 C ratio is known, a "radiocarbon age" is calculated using:[61]
doc.after: The calculation uses Libby's half-life of 5,568 years, not the more accurate modern value of 5,730 years. Libbyâs value for the half-life is used to maintain consistency with early radiocarbon testing results; calibration curves include a correction for this, so the accuracy of final reported calendar ages is assured.[61]
